body_html: Apparently if you don't have shell=true in subprocess, Windows won't figure out that "git" command should run "git.cmd". At least according to a stack overflow I read. The other workaround would just to be to catch Exception in this block instead of CalledProcessError
body_text: Apparently if you don't have shell=true in subprocess, Windows won't figure out that "git" command should run "git.cmd". At least according to a stack overflow I read. The other workaround would just to be to catch Exception in this block instead of CalledProcessError
body: Apparently if you don't have shell=true in subprocess, Windows won't figure out that "git" command should run "git.cmd". At least according to a stack overflow I read. The other workaround would just to be to catch Exception in this block instead of CalledProcessError
